title: Koichi Osamura
text:
Hello!
I am a doctoral candidate in Political Science at the University of Vienna. My research interests include legislative behavior, coalition politics, and political parties. I am particularly interested in the coalition politics in multiparty presidential systems, but also on learning new techniques related to quantitative text analyses.
I like spending my (rare) free time testing which color pallet fits the best for my ggplots, and I always end up frustrated – with the time I wasted on it, and because papers will end up being in grayscale anyway.






 Contact:
koichi.osamura[at]univie.ac.at
University of Vienna
Department of Government
Rooseveltplatz 3,
1090 Vienna, Austria

title: Teaching
text:
I have taught the following seminar courses at the University of Vienna:
Winter 2024 Parties and Institutions (BA level)
- Student evaluation (group 1): 1.5 (1 = best, 5 = worse; 17 respondents)
- Student evaluation (group 2): 1.6 (1 = best, 5 = worse; 20 respondents)

Winter 2023 Comparative Political Analysis (BA level)
- Student evaluation: 2.0 (1 = best, 5 = worse; 22 respondents)

Further information can be found in the University’s course directory.

title: Research
text:
What is the price of loyalty? An analysis on the efficiency of presidential perks in sustaining legislative support in South America

Supervised by Prof. Thomas M. Meyer, PhD, and Prof. Dr. Laurenz Ennser-Jedenastik.







The Politics of Portfolio Design in European Democracies

PI: Thomas Meyer, PhD (University of Vienna) and Dr. Ulrich Sieberer (University of Bamberg).
Funding: Austrian Science Fund (grant number: I 5876-G) and German Research Foundation (grant number: SI 1470/9-1)
Collaborators: David Schmuck, Hanna Bäck, Andrea Ceron, Albert Falcó-Gimeno, Benjamin Giunaudeau, Isabelle Guinaudeau, Martin Ejnar Hansen, Kristoffer Kolltveit, Tom Louwerse, Wolfgang C. Müller, and Thomas Persson.
https://governmentportfolios.eu/


Ideological synergies as proxy for coalition efficiency in presidential systems

Presented at Japanese Society for Quantitative Political Science 2025 Winter Meeting.

Presented at ECPR 2024 General Conference.


The weight of patronage on the passage of salient policies in presidential systems

Presented at ECPR 2024 General Conference.






Safely Endangered

title: Media
text:
Written outlets


30/09/2024
Expresso (Portugal)



“Extrema-direita no ‘impasse’ após ganhar na Áustria: deixa cair líder responsável por resultado histórico ou fica fora do Governo?” (“Far-right in a ‘deadlock’ after winning in Austria: will they drop their leader aiming for a historical result or stay out of government?”)




06/12/2023
Valor Econômico (Brazil)



“A indicação de Dino e a polêmica ideia de dar nota aos candidatos ao STF (”Dino’s appointment and the polemic idea of grading Supreme Court candidates”)




Podcasts


13/02/2025
Expresso (Portugal)



“Governo de extrema-direita na Áustria dará à UE “um segundo Orbán (”Far-right government in Austria will give the EU ‘a second Orbán’”)
